page.title: 04THROWLEY SCHOOL CLOSURE
page.content: When Mr J.E.C.Viner, our last headmaster, got another headship in Rochester, the Kent County Council looked into the future of the school. 12th September 1984 - the schools sub- committee recommended the closure of Throwley school to the County Council. 8th October 1984 - the full education committee decided to close Throwley school. 26th October 1984 - The closure notice was issued and displayed outside the school. The parents and friends, as well as the governors both prepared detailed reports supporting the school, through a lot of evening meetings. An appeal was then sent to the Minister. 3rd June 1985 - It was announced that the appeal had been rejected by Sir Keith Joseph. Throwley school closes at the end of this term.
